a11rallypong

Class GameOverGUI

  • java.lang.Object
    • a11rallypong.GameOverGUI

  • public class GameOverGUI
extends java.lang.Object
    The GameOverGUI class creates a GUI for the user to submit their score to the save file of scores or quit the game without saving it. If they submit their score, they are immediately brought to the HighScoresGUI to view it. If they don't save it, they are brought to the main menu.
    Author:
    Erich

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      GameOverGUI()
      Create the application.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Static Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      static java.awt.Rectangle getScreenTotalArea(java.awt.Window windowOrNull)
      The getScreenTotalArea method finds the size of the users screen so that the game can be full screen on any screen size and the play area will adapt to this size.
      void setCurrentScore(int hitcount)
      The setCurrentScore method takes an integer and sets the current score of the game for this GUI to be saved to the file.

    • Method Detail

      • getScreenTotalArea

        public static java.awt.Rectangle getScreenTotalArea(java.awt.Window windowOrNull)
        The getScreenTotalArea method finds the size of the users screen so that the game can be full screen on any screen size and the play area will adapt to this size.
        Parameters:
        windowOrNull - the window the method should find the size of.
        Returns:
        a Rectangle representing the dimensions of the screen.

      • setCurrentScore

        public void setCurrentScore(int hitcount)
        The setCurrentScore method takes an integer and sets the current score of the game for this GUI to be saved to the file.
        Parameters:
        hitcount - a count of hits representing a score.
